Hunched Back, Dry Bloodshot Eyes, Sallow Skin - This Is The Future Of Office Goers In 20 Years

Emma is the office goer of the future and she has swollen limbs, hunched back and bloodshot eyes. If our working conditions remain the same, our future will be just like hers.

Researchers have built a life-sized dummy to show how the work culture that requires us to sit at our desks most of the day, might have serious repercussions.

Behavioural Futurist William Higham and a team of experts, investigated the effects of office, indoor work life, on the health of the employees. To avoid being like Emma, radical changes - which include more ergonomic offices, and breaks - have been suggested.





Mr Higham reportedly said, “The Work Colleague of the Future report shows that employers and workers really need to act now and address the problem of poor workplace health."

“Unless we make radical changes to our working lives, such as moving more, addressing our posture at our desks, taking regular walking breaks or considering improving our workstation setup, our offices are going to make us very sick."

“As a result, workers in the future could suffer health problems as bad as those we thought we’d left behind in the Industrial Revolution.”

Emma has a hunched posture because she sits for hours over a desk, her eyes are dry and bloodshot because of prolonged exposure to screens.

If a change is not brought about in our lifestyles, this is what the future holds for us. It's terrifying, but we have a chance to steer ourselves away from this particular version.
